intro: Matayba heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaved matayba, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its alternate, often lobed leaves that vary in shape depending on the environment. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Matayba heterophylla is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
